IncidentAddress.IncAddrComment: NB RT 301 S/O OAK BARREL CT

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: This incident was recorded on an in-car and body-worn camera system (H-22). Defendant: Eric James Moses (DOB: 08/19/1970). Date and time of Arrest: 11/20/2023 0104 hrs Temperature: 43 degrees Weather Condition: Clear Foot Wear: Black Athletic Shoes Eye Color: Brown DUI #: 23-380 Case #: 23-MSP-041074 Certification and training: -Certified RADAR/LIDAR Operator -Trained/Certified in Standardized Field Sobriety Testing through the Maryland State Police Academy VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1) On Monday, November 20, 2023, at approximately 0045 hours, I, Trooper Matthews #7664 while operating marked MSP patrol vehicle H-22, was traveling north-bound Route 301 south of Oak Barrel Ct, Brandywine, Prince Georges County, Maryland 20613. At that time, I observed a white Lexus 460 bearing Maryland registration (9DM0951) traveling north-bound Route 301 in lane two in front of my vehicle. I observed the white Lexus swerving over the solid white lines (4) times and not maintaining its lane. I activated my emergency equipment and conducted a traffic stop on the vehicle. PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2) I made contact with the driver of the Lexus later identified by his Maryland drivers license as Eric James Moses (DOB: 08/19/1970). While speaking with him, I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his breath and person. I also observed Moses eyes to be bloodshot and glassy. I explained to him the reason for my traffic stop and asked Moses if he could tell me where he was coming from. Moses stated he was coming from his buddys house in Waldorf, Maryland and stated he was there a few hours watching football games. I asked Moses if he had anything to drink tonight, and he stated he did not. I asked Moses to step out of the vehicle, to which he complied.While outside his car Moses had difficulty keeping his balance and was using his vehicle as leverage to maintain his balance. While Moses was walking towards my vehicle, he stumbled over his feet twice. Once we got back to my vehicle, I continued to detect a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from Mosess breath and person.I asked Moses if he would be willing to perform Standardized Field Sobriety Tests to which he consented. The test results are as follows. PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3) The evaluation was performed at the side of the road, in front of my patrol vehicle. The surface was dry, level and free from any debris or obstructions. Lighting conditions consisted of headlamps, streetlights and my flashlight, with any front emergency lights deactivated. Moses appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any visible injuries, limps, or limb ailments. Medical conditions or injuries which would inhibit Mosess ability to walk in a straight line or stand on one foot: Moses Stated he had brain surgery thats effects the right side of his body which causes twitching sometimes. Medications: Sleeping pills and also claims to take medication for anxiety and stress Glasses: Yes HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (6/6) The test was properly explained and administered per the NHTSA SFST Manual. margin-left:24px">Lack of Smooth Pursuit - Present in both eyes,2 clues. margin-left:24px">Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation - Present in both eyes, 2 clues. margin-left:24px">Onset of Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degree - Present in both eyes, 2 clues. margin-left:24px">Vertical Nystagmus Not Observed. WAKE AND TURN (DNP) The test was properly explained and administered per the NHTSA SFST Manual. Instructional Stage: Moses broke the instruction stage multiple times and I had to advise Moses to get back into the instructional stage position multiple times. Moses also had to have me explain and demonstrate the test multiple times. I asked Moses if he understood my instructions, and he responded verbally and stated he didnt want to do the test. I responded and explained to Moses he didnt have to do the test if he didnt want to and asked if he would feel comfortable moving on to the next test. Moses stated he would feel comfortable moving on to the next test. ONE LEG STAND - (2/4) The test was properly explained and administered per the NHTSA SFST Manual. margin-left:48px">Moses swayed on counts 9, 10, 11 margin-left:48px">Mosesputs his foot down on counts 6, 12, 13, 14 ARREST Based on the following totality of the circumstances, I had reason to believe that Moses was driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol: margin-left:39px">Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from the Mosess breath and person. margin-left:39px">Eyes glossy and bloodshot. margin-left:39px">6/6 clues on HGN, 2/4 clues on OLS. margin-left:39px">Unable to maintain his balance. Due to my observations, I concluded Moses was driving under the influence of alcohol and was unable to operate a vehicle safely.At 0105 hours, I placed Moses under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol. A preliminary search of Moses was conducted on scene. I read Moses the DR-15 Advice of Rights formverbatim on scene. After hearing the form read in its entirety, I asked Moses if he wished to submit to take the intoximeter test to measure his breath alcohol concentration. Moses reviewed the DR-15 and signed his name as a refusal.Moses was transported to the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack for processing. Moses was provided all pertinent paperwork and was released from the Forestville Barrack to a sober driver. Charges Moses was charged with the following citations: margin-left:39px">Driving while under the influence of alcohol (05D0ZJ2) margin-left:39px">Driving while impaired by alcohol (05H0ZJ2) margin-left:39px">Reckless Driving (05G0ZJ2) margin-left:39px">Negligent Driving (05F0ZJ2) margin-left:39px">Failure to drive vehicle on right half of roadway (05C0ZJ2) margin-left:39px">Driving vehicle on highway with a suspended registration (05J0ZJ2) margin-left:39px">Failure to notify ADM of address change within 30 days (05K0ZJ2) All the above events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland. Case closed by arrest.
